definition: posturing/pretentious/affected
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
cavity of body/barrel (e.g. engine cylinder)/compartment/tune/accent of speech
worker/workshop/(slang) troublesome/high-maintenance (person)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works
power/influence/potential/momentum/tendency/trend/situation/conditions/outward appearance/sign/gesture/male genitals

sentences.english: The posturing before the camera on bothe sides repelled me.
sentences.chinese: 双方在摄像机前装腔作势的姿态令我作呕。

sentences.english: The posturing before the camera on both sides repelled me.
sentences.chinese: 双方在摄像机前装腔作势的姿态令我作呕。

sentences.english: Depending upon heroics to get your product out the door is simply bad program management.
sentences.chinese: 让装腔作势使你的产品出局是最糟糕的项目管理。

sentences.english: People can smell a poser from a mile away.
sentences.chinese: 人们在一英里之外都可以闻到装腔作势的人的气味。

sentences.english: He behaved like our equal, without any haughtiness , putting on airs or something like that.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动是那样的亲切，一点也不傲慢或者装腔作势。

sentences.english: Behavior characteristic is self- dramatizing , mincing.
sentences.chinese: 行为特点是自吹自擂，装腔作势。

sentences.english: He's a poseur and never actually writes anything.
sentences.chinese: 他们是装腔作势的人，实际上从来不写任何东西。

sentences.english: In this phase, the shouts and histrionics will abate somewhat.
sentences.chinese: 在这个阶段，大呼小叫和装腔作势都将减少。

sentences.english: Paris,--let us confess it--willingly allows infamy to furnish it with comedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该承认巴黎心甘情愿让无耻在那儿装腔作势。

sentences.english: Stop mouthing and listen to what I have to say.
sentences.chinese: 别再装腔作势，好好听听我说的话。

sentences.english: it's a kind of feminized, mincing approach to the novel.
sentences.chinese: 是一种女性化，装腔作势地接近小说。

sentences.english: She loves to pose when men are around.
sentences.chinese: 当有男人在四周时她喜欢装腔作势，故作姿态。

sentences.english: Unlike most Spanish bosses, Mr Roig doesn't mince his words.
sentences.chinese: 与西班牙大多数的老板不同，罗伊先生不会装腔作势。

sentences.english: In New Testament times, the Pharisees were pros at pretentious prayers.
sentences.chinese: 在新约时代，法利赛人专爱装腔作势的祷告。

definition: to put on an act
to put on an attitude/to pose
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
hypocritical/unctuous/insincerely courteous/to shed crocodile tears
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
to show off/to make a display of
affected/artificial
lit. dress up as God, play the devil (idiom); fig. to mystify/to deceive people/to scam
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
false/hypocritical/artificial/sham
see 做派[zuo4 pai4]
to think highly of oneself
sanctimonious/dignified
eccentric/peculiar/mystifying
to put on airs/to assume great airs
